itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Gwyn Richards (22 December 1905 – 17 December 1985) was a Welsh rugby union and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Bryncethin RFC, Bridgend RFC, Cardiff RFC and Torquay Athletic RFC, as a fly-half, i.e. number 10, and club level rugby league (RL) for Huddersfield, and Leigh (Heritage № 445), as a stand-off, i.e. number 6.

response: *17 December –  Gwyn Richards, dual-code rugby player, 79
*22 December – Gwyn Richards, dual-code rugby player (died 1985)

* Gwyn Richards - fly-half who played for the club in the 1920s after spending much of his early career in his native Wales with the likes of Bridgend RFC and Cardiff RFC.  Gained a solitary cap for Wales in 1927 before switching to rugby league.  Died in 1985.
